title.narrative: Greening Uganda’s Urbanization and Industrialization

description.narrative: FOCAL SECTOR 3:Planned Green Cities: improve urbanization in Kampala and secondary cities GOAL: Greening Uganda’s Urbanization and Industrialisation IMPACT OBJECTIVE:Achieve strong, inclusive and sustainable economic growth

To address urbanization, industrialization and waste management challenges in the country, the proposed project will support Uganda's (1) green city development by preparing the urban development guidelines and the preparation of the masterplans for two secondary cities and infrastructure investment plans for these cities to include pipeline of priority project, develop local area plans and Neighborhood Plans and establishing a knowledge and stakeholder engagement platform to rally support, build capacity and raise awareness of relevant stakeholders; (2) green industrialization by developing the green free zone and industrial park guidelines and the green industrialization masterplan, designing model green free zone, green free zone policy and green industrial park and providing financing and investments options including one bankable project concept note for possible funding to facilitate industrial park development; (3) efficient waste management by developing the Greater Kampala Metropolitan Authority (GKMA) waste management strategy, designing two waste sorting and diversion centers in GKMA, assessing oil and petroleum waste and e-waste recycling potential and designing an SME fund for waste management value chain actors and an accelerator to facilitate SME access to the fund by providing business development support; and (4) integration of green growth into planning and budgeting system and effective communication of UGGDS. Throughout the project implementation, stakeholder engagement is an integral part of project to address gender equality and social inclusiveness and garner support from stakeholders. Capacity building activities will be conducted to ensure government staff, relevant private sector partners and subnational stakeholders understand and are empowered to adapt and implement the guidelines and master plans developed.

mailing-address.narrative: Global Green Growth Institute, 19F Jeongdong Bldg., 21-15 Jeongdong-gil, Jung-gu Seoul 04564 Republic of Korea

Project Management

description.narrative: • Project is delivered on time and on budget • Project is following GGGI and EU guidelines and principles, including the GGGI’s Poverty and Gender Equality Policy Marker policy and the Monitoring and Evaluation (M&E) requirements.

title.narrative: Contingencies 5%
Overheads 7%

• Kick-off and closing workshops • Human Resource Management • Financial Management and Procurement • Monitoring, Evaluation and Reporting • Safeguards, Poverty Reduction and Social Inclusion (SPRSI) • Governance by the Technical Steering Committee existing out of Government Stakeholders
GKMA Waste Management Strategy Developed

description.narrative: • Survey results • Minimal 5 sites selected for potential waste sorting and diversion centers • GKMA Waste Management Strategy and implementation plan finalized and submitted for adoption to the KCCA and MoKMA • GKMA Waste Collection and Transportation Concession model revised to improve logistics and inclusion.

title.narrative: 3.1.1 Conduct a survey to identify the expected waste flows, amounts, waste composition and sites for potential waste sorting and diversion centers. • Activity 3.1.2 Support the KCCA and MoKMA with the development of the Waste Management Strategy, the revised Waste Collection and Transportation Concession Model and the implementation plan for the strategy • Activity 3.1.3 Support the KCCA and MoKMA with Capacity Building of the relevant stakeholders to be able to apply the guidelines

3.1.2 Support the KCCA and MoKMA with the development of the Waste Management Strategy, the revised Waste Collection and Transportation Concession Model and the implementation plan for the strategy 3.1.3 Support the KCCA and MoKMA with Capacity Building of the relevant stakeholders to be able to apply the guidelines.

description.narrative: • The Budget Tracker for public finance includes Green Growth Indicators (including gender, poverty and social inclusion indicators) • The MRV is operational and high quality data is collected • Green Growth is reported in the upcoming BUR’s • Capacity on GG Indicators reporting enhanced in the relevant Ministries (at least 100 people).

A knowledge and engagement platform established by Makerere University

description.narrative: • The Makerere University Regional Centre for Urban Research, Governance and Innovation (MURCURGI) is operational (with functioning hardware) • 4 National Multi-Stakeholder Platforms dialogues held by the Centre • 9 Research Papers finalized and submitted for publication to the relevant outlets • 2 Short Course Training modules/manuals developed submitted for adoption by the Centre • All students enrolled in the course acquire practical skills as provided by the training • 3 trainings per course delivered by the Center, resulting in 150 trained students/participants. • At least 100 trained individuals will train 1000 individuals (public and private) at Municipal level. • Beneficiaries and/or participants of the platform are equally men and women

Investment opportunities for oil/petroleum waste and e-waste products identified

description.narrative: • Two value chain analysis have been finalized including a policy / institutional framework assessment, recommendations will be provided for incentivization, recycling and valorization. • At least two investment projects concepts have been developed. • An action plan for these subsectors to reduce the constraint on the environment and enhance the circular opportunities for Uganda.

title.narrative: 3.4.1 Execute a value chain analysis of oil/petroleum waste products • Activity 3.4.2 Execute a value chain analysis of e-waste products • Activity 3.4.3 Recommendations are provided and discussed with the relevant Governmental stakeholders including (but not limited to) KCCA, MoLG, MLHUD, NEMA and the Ministry of ICT
